q: When should flood-barrier gaskets be replaced?
a: Every 5 years in coastal climates or when compression set exceeds 25 %. Cracked or flattened gaskets lose seal pressure and cause seepage.
EPDM or neoprene rated –20 °C to +80 °C. Silicone variants for chemical plants. Always match OEM profile to maintain UL 50E watertight rating.

q: How do I remove old gaskets?
a: Use plastic scraper; avoid metal tools. Clean channel with denatured alcohol before inserting new seal. See panel repair.
